org.hs.util.file
Class SuperFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.File
        |
        +--org.hs.util.file.SuperFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable, OptionsConstants, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
LogBase, Script
public class SuperFile
extends java.io.File
implements java.io.Serializable, OptionsConstants

A java.io.File with more features. Note: methods will only abort on exception; if an operation expects to return false, it will continue performing as many successful operations as it can.

See Also:
Serialized Form

copyContentsInto

public boolean copyContentsInto(java.io.File toDir,
                                int options)
                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                java.io.IOException
Copy the contents of this into toDir

Parameters:
options - accepts Options.INCLUDE_SUBDIRS and Options.OVERWRITE
Returns:
true iff all the files that could have been copied, per the options, were successfully copied (e.g., returns false if Options.OVERWRITE is not set and at least one of the files within this dir exists in toDir).

copyInto

public boolean copyInto(java.io.File toDir,
                        int options)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
Copy this to toDir

Parameters:
toDir - must be a directory (or return false)
options - accepts Options.OVERWRITE iff this.isFile(); accepts Options.INCLUDE_SUBDIRS iff this.isDirectory()
Returns:
true iff this is completely copied (per the options) to toDir
java.io.FileNotFoundException

emptyDirectory

public boolean emptyDirectory(int options)
Delete the contents of this directory

Parameters:
options - accepts Options.INCLUDE_SUBDIRS
Returns:
true iff this directory exists and is empty after the operation completes (i.e., will return false if subdirectories exist and the Options.INCLUDE_SUBDIRS option is not specified; also will return false if this directory doesn't exist to begin with)

list

public SuperFile[] list(java.lang.String filter)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Similar to File.list(), but accepts a gnu regular expression, as defined in gnu.regexp.RESyntax.RE_SYNTAX_PERL5, and returns an array of SuperFile.
